item.title: Its all pointless.
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
25 minutes ago, WhatAWondefulWorld said:

@Leo Gura

Leo, I love you and respect everything you say, but life has not been the best to me especially through childhood. I have been so broken down and hurt that life lost all purpose, there was nothing that mattered. I was on the brink of suicide when I came across your channel on youtube and it saved me. I have come a long way already and I don't think there is anything else meaningful to do in my life than to pursue understanding.

I understand that I need to get a job and shit to feed myself and be able to have a home but I don't know how to fix myself

That's precisely my point. You probably have lots of shadow material to work out.

And you should find something about life that you're passionate about. This should come prior to enlightenment. Build up your passion. You are at risk for avoiding the fundamentals and trying to skip straight to the end, which will likely fail.

Learn basic arithmetic before you jump into calculus.

I don't sense that you are strong enough yet to handle enlightenment. Of course you are welcome to prove me wrong.

Build a normal life that you can be reasonably satisfied with. It's crucial to learn how to be passionate about life. Later you can transcend it. But your current nihilistic attitude is not good.

item.title: Green Party 2020
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
17 minutes ago, ivory said:

@Leo Gura What type of candidate do you think would the most effective in moving the country forward? A "hardcore" liberal like Sanders, or a moderate like Biden? In other words, do you think we need someone pushing for massive change, whose ideas will largely be challenged and rejected by those who fear change? Or a centrist who can appeal to both sides and move the country forward at a slow pace?

I think someone as bold as Bernie will have a tough time getting elected. But Biden is a bit too centrist. Something above Biden but below Bernie might be most workable.

I think Gavin Newsom is likely to become the next Dem president. He's quite progressive. I expect him to run in 2024 or 2028. He would be a very strong candidate.

Really, we need more fresh progressive faces in politics. One of Bernie's problems was simply his image. He's too old and lacks charisma. We need to try someone similar to him but younger and more charismatic. Someone like Obama but more progressive. And without the label "socialist". That socialist label is a shitshow.

And thanks to You Leo for Your very existence. Cannot Thank You enough.

But it should still be highly effective. You don't need what I got in my video. That's too much for you. I came to the brink of disappearing.

There are some dangers, mostly the dangers of taking too much, passing out, throwing up, breath stopping, and overwhelming traumatic breakthroughs.

But most of these dangers you should be able to mitigate with proper planning, research, and communication with your shaman. Tell him to start you low and ramp you up.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Leo Gura I would probably have a sore asshole afterwards😉 but yeah I guess if you wanna keep on boofing that shit go right ahead...

item.title: Question about Leos latest Video
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

The only time you will ever become completely unbiased is when you're dead. Not enlightenment dead. Dead dead.

I don't care how enlightened you are, if your body is alive, you will be biased. That is a requirement of life.

You are biased for a very good reason. Without it you'd be dead.

You are stuck in an existential bind. Either you choose bias and life, or you choose unbias and death. This choice itself is a bias!

But there are also many degrees of bias. You can be much less biased without dying. You don't have to be like Fox News to survive.

item.title: Derek Moneybird
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

If you're at Orange, a no-nonsense teacher like Derek can be very useful. And even at Green it's useful. He's teaching you how to get shit done. How to be pragmatic and grounded.

Many of you lack that. It's a good thing to spend a few years training up.

Too much YT spiritual talk makes you soft and weak.

item.title: Loving toxicity
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
6 minutes ago, neovox said:

Its the cost of expressing love that I question. They exploit, abuse, manipulate, blame others, victimize themselves at every turn. Their behavior can be so toxic that just short interactions drains tf out of me, to put it lightly.

The cost of true love is your life.

That's what Jesus showed you.

As long as you worry about yourself, your love will be limited.

But with that said, in practice, don't hang around toxic people. It's that simple. Unless you deliberately wish to do so to test and grow your love.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Look guys. I'm not going to argue with you because I'm speaking of a level of consciousness of none of you have any clue about.

You are not even 0.000000000001% close to Infinite Consciousness.

You can play all the games you want and tell me all the spiritual shit you've learned over the years.

And none of it will shake me.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 minutes ago, traveler said:

There is no person to be handling pure love forever. God is already pure love forever right now, it's the same thing, no seperation. 

No

God is limiting itself so you can be talking.

You have no idea God's purest form.

God is limiting itself for you. Because you're scared shitless of Love.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Meta-Man Look man, you're definitely NOT in a state of Infinite Consciousness right now. You can fool yourself, but you ain't fooling me. You just ain't. I don't care how enlightened you think you are or what insights you think you've had.

You're not in Infinite Consciousness. If you were, your body would be dead.

Please open your mind to this possibility. You're nowhere near Infinite Consciousness and no amount of enlightenment will get you there.

item.title: Heart broken open since watching Leo's Last Video
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@wordsforliving It's not so hard to travel to Mexico or South America and smoke some toad.

Why waste time? Do what fucking works.

Shamans travel around the world offering toad ceremonies.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

With mahasamadhi you become so conscious that you realize that form and life are still limits, and you decide to release those limits to forever become Infinite, formless Love.

You completely wake up. The end.

You become pure LOVE, pure UNITY. The dream of life is completely transcended. You let it go. You realize it was just a children's sandbox, a training ground.

God created life for those who cannot handle PURE LOVE FOREVER.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
4 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

Consciousness is never limited. Consciousness is a constant.

It is limited in you right now.

Quote

The appearance of limitations appear within it. 

Yes, and appearance is reality. So by imagining being limited, you become limited.

If you dream of being a kangaroo, that's limited consciousness. A kangaroo is a finite, limited thing.

Quote

Remove the limitations and Consciousness remains in its pristine state.

Removing all limitations would remove all form. Form is a limit.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
12 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

Then whats the difference between shooting oneself in the head and ‘performing a mahasamadhi’? 

Not much other than that with mahasamadhi you consciously decide to become Infinite Consciousness forever.

With suicide, who knows what will happen next? You might dream up some hell realm that you go to. A suicidal person will probably not abide in Infinite Consciousness because they're killing themselves out of lack of consciousness to begin with. So they may reincarnate many times or dream up whatever other stuff.

Quote

Consciousness remains throughout birth and death of the body.

Yes, of course, consciousness doesn't go anywhere. But the question remains, what is consciousness gonna be doing? Will it dreaming it's a human? A kangaroo? Or will it is be pure Infinity?

How is your consciousness doing? << that's a very important question. Right now it's busy dreaming being human.

10 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

Thousands of people commit suicide everyday.

Lol

Try to commit suicide without touching your body in front of 50 people.

Quote

But you don’t know mate. You just admitted.

If you do 100 breakthrough trips of 5-MeO-DMT. You'll know.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 minutes ago, traveler said:

@Leo Gura also, If that ain't even samadhi, I dont know what is, lmao😂 Why are you so quick to believe your the only one who has seen yourself brother?

I said your experience was a lesser samadhi. But not mahasamdhi, since you're still a human.

You can reach levels of infinite consciousness and return to your body.

2 minutes ago, Derek White said:

@Leo Gura He also mentions there are ways to retain mahasamadhi while still being alive.

You don't retain mahasamadhi. Mahasamadhi means your body is dead.

You can have other samadhis which don't require you to leave your body forever. That would be traditional enlightenment.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
4 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

@Leo Gura

She couldn’t be able to know such a thing is possible herself. Because she hadn’t gone through it. 

Lol, she's fucking dead. She had a young daughter.

When your consciousnesses gets close to becoming totally infinite. You'll know.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

How are they able to report it?

Well, for example, Sadhguru's wife is said to have done mahasamadhi on a schedule and in front of many people who watched her, including, I assume, Sadhguru.

This is far from the only well-documented public case of mahasamadhi.

https://isha.sadhguru.org/us/en/wisdom/sadhguru-spot/mahasamadhi

Please be careful. This is a very serious and radical possibility. This is not for average seekers.

I only speak of it because I felt that I was coming close to it. So this is more of a warning to you guys.

item.title: Important insight from mahasamdhi
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

How can you know such a thing exists when you haven’t gone through it?

The very nature of such a thing is that one cannot know until one is there and never to come back here.

I cannot know. I suspect. Plenty of yogis report mahasamadhi. So it's not like I'm the first to make it up.

But most of you here believe that one day your body will drop dead. So what then? That is basically forced mahasamadhi. So really you're not being asked to buy anything so outlandish with mahasamadhi.

Once is too much.

@Leo Gura have you had realizations on LSD close to those of 5-MeO?  LSD takes me incredibly deep, deeper and clearer than most other psychs.

The only upside to LSD is its superior length.

item.title: Overall, what do you guys think of the Dalai Lama?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

It's not a question of if he is awake but how deeply is he awake?

And the answer is, you don't know.

item.title: Did I almost take it too far?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
18 minutes ago, Meta-Man said:

Yes ego is a state of consciousness, but it manifests primarlily on the level of feeling You feel contracted/limited. Thought is secondary.

I generally agree. Feeling is deeper than thought.

Being human is basically a kind of feeling. You can shut off all thought, but you will still feel human. It has to be that way since most animals don't think. But they do feel. Feeling is more basic and more essential. A baby feels before it thinks. You can survive without thinking, but not without feeling.
